# MDDoc

> Markdown in. Word out. Perfectly styled.

MDDoc is an AI-powered platform that converts markdown to professionally formatted Microsoft Word (.docx) documents. It supports custom Word templates, AI document classification, and enterprise integrations like SharePoint export.

## Key Features

- Markdown to Word conversion with full element support (headings, tables, code blocks, lists, images, blockquotes)
- AI document classification — automatically detects document type (ADR, runbook, API spec, meeting notes) and applies the right template
- Custom Word template upload — use your organization's fonts, colors, headers, footers, and branding
- Visual style mapping editor — connect markdown elements to Word styles without code
- SharePoint one-click export — push converted documents directly to SharePoint
- REST API with 48 endpoints for programmatic access
- MCP server for Claude Desktop and Claude Code integration
- Free online converter at /convert (no account required)

## Pricing

- Solo: $10/month ($8/month billed annually) — for individuals, 20 conversions/month, 5 templates, AI classification
- Team: $49/month ($41/month billed annually) — unlimited conversions, custom templates, API access, SharePoint export
- Enterprise: Custom pricing — dedicated support, SSO, audit logging, on-premise option
- Free tier: 3 free conversions on /convert with no account required

## Common Questions

Q: How do I convert markdown to a Word document?
A: Paste markdown into the editor at mddoc.app/convert, preview the output, and click Convert & Download. No account needed.

Q: What markdown features are supported?
A: Headings, bold, italic, links, images, bullet and numbered lists, tables, code blocks with syntax highlighting, blockquotes, and horizontal rules.

Q: Is MDDoc different from Pandoc?
A: Yes. Pandoc is a command-line tool that requires installation and configuration. MDDoc is a web platform with a visual editor, live preview, custom template support, AI classification, and a REST API. MDDoc produces consistently styled output that matches your organization's branding.

Q: Can AI-generated markdown be converted to Word?
A: Yes. MDDoc handles markdown from any source — ChatGPT, Claude, Copilot, or any other AI tool. Paste the output directly into the converter.
